channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Ben Horowitz will donate to Harris campaign after Trump support
item.description: Horowitz emphasized the personal nature of the donation, saying he and his wife, Felicia, have known Harris for years and she has been “a great friend...

item.title: A Deluge of Rain Poured Out of the Heavens. But There’s Still No Drinking Water.
item.description: City officials have refused to provide estimates of when the devastated water system in Asheville, N.C., will be back in operation.

item.title: Ukraine’s Donbas Strategy: Retreat Slowly and Maximize Russian Losses
item.description: The idea is to use rope-a-dope tactics, letting Russian forces pound away until they have exhausted themselves. It’s far from clear if the Ukrainian s...

item.title: David Paterson, Former New York Governor, Is Attacked in Manhattan
item.description: Mr. Paterson and his stepson suffered minor injuries in a street attack on Friday. The former governor was not believed to have been targeted in the a...

item.title: As Israel Attacks, Many Lebanese Feel Dragged Into War
item.description: In a crisis-racked country where sectarian tensions simmer, many worry that the conflict between Israel and the Shiite militia Hezbollah will end in m...

item.title: Gang Attack in Haiti Leaves 70 People Dead
item.description: The assault took place in a key agricultural region, which has seen a surge in gang violence.

item.title: As Israel Attacks, Many Lebanese Feel Dragged Into War

item.title: California vineyard owner says he was fined $120,000 for providing free housing to employee
item.description: The owner is suing Santa Clara County after officials fined him for allowing his longtime employee to live in an RV on his property for years.

item.title: Oklahoma’s unusual requirements for school Bibles match Trump-endorsed version
item.description: Former Oklahoma Attorney General Drew Edmondson, a Democrat, said the bid “does not pass the smell test” and said a court could void it.

item.title: Oil ‘tourists’ pile into market amid biggest rally in two years
item.description: Volumes in the United States Oil Fund surged this week to the highest levels since Russia invaded Ukraine in 2022.

item.title: Live Updates: Israel Strikes Across Lebanon as Attacks Expand
item.description: Israel’s attacks against Hezbollah had largely been concentrated in the south and near Beirut. But Hamas, an ally of Hezbollah, said an Israeli strike...

item.title: Solving America’s housing crisis means fixing the ‘ROI problem,’ says White House economist
item.description: “From the perspective of developers, building affordable housing just does not pencil out.”

item.title: French Judge in Gisèle Pelicot Rape Trial Allows Video Evidence to Be Shown in Court
item.description: Gisèle Pelicot fought for the graphic videos made by her husband to be shown publicly in court, insisting they were essential evidence in a rape case ...

item.title: Bosnia Balkans flooding rains
item.description: A severe overnight rainstorm in the Balkans left several towns and villages flooded. Record summer temperatures had caused a drought that hampered the...
